definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Linda phoned me in on arrival so that I know she was safe and sound.
sentences.chinese: 琳達到達後給我打了電話，因而我知道她平安無事。
那一夜平安無事地過去了。

sentences.english: eg5. All his sons returned safe and sound form the war.
sentences.chinese: 他所有的兒子都從戰爭中平安無事地回來了。

sentences.english: I guess we just wanted to know that each other were ok.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們只是想確認一下所有人都平安無事。

sentences.english: It was a blessing that everyone got out of the fire safely.
sentences.chinese: 很感恩的是每一個人都平安無事地逃離火場。

sentences.english: Megan's arrival on Montserrat was both welcoming and initially uneventful.
sentences.chinese: 梅根到蒙特塞拉特後受到歡迎，最初也平安無事。

sentences.english: For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him go away safe?
sentences.chinese: 人若遇見仇敵，豈肯放他平安無事地去呢？

sentences.english: This document will enable her to pass through the enemy lines unmolested.
sentences.chinese: 這證件將使她能平安無事地通過敵人防線。

sentences.english: It was a quiet, uneventful flight of less than three hours.
sentences.chinese: 這段不到三個小時的航程一路平安無事。

sentences.english: Eg: 1. We can't share your faith that everything will be all right.
sentences.chinese: 對於你那一切會平安無事的信念，我不能同意。

sentences.english: Many men before Gautama in that land of uneventful sunshine had found life distressing and mysterious.
sentences.chinese: 在這一片平安無事的，陽光和煦的土地上，早在喬。

sentences.english: Had she fallen among thieves, it would have kept her safe.
sentences.chinese: 假若她落進盜賊之手，那紅字也會保她平安無事。

sentences.english: But we just prayed that God would bring us through it.
sentences.chinese: 但我們只是祈禱，上帝會讓我們平安無事的。

sentences.english: Most of the world is at peace.
sentences.chinese: 世界大部分地區平安無事。

sentences.english: The rest of the detective's night passed uneventfully.
sentences.chinese: 這位警探的後半夜倒是平安無事。

definition: safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
